intro: Sanguisorba ancistroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bloodwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often red or purple flowers. The plant features lanceolate, often reddish-tinged leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to native plant gardens.
